author: @teletica7
title: Incendio consumió 45 hectáreas de terreno en Bagaces de Guanacaste
text:
Sucesos
Incendio consumió 45 hectáreas de terreno en Bagaces de Guanacaste
Lo seco del pasto, las altas temperaturas e incluso los fuertes vientos fueron factores que favorecieron la intensificación de las llamas.
Dudly Lynch
5/3/2025 21:21
Un incendio consumió 45 hectáreas de terreno en Bagaces de Guanacaste (ver video adjunto de Telenoticias).
Esta propiedad se utiliza para la siembra y posterior cosecha de pacas para la alimentación de animales.
Por razones que aún no están claras, de manera repentina inició un fuego y se expandió en segundos.
“Atendemos una quema de vegetación en la Hacienda Montenegro con afectación de 45 hectáreas. Gracias al trabajo de la unidad operativa forestal se logró proteger aproximadamente 100 hectáreas”, dijo Jimmy García, bomberos Guanacaste.
Lo seco del pasto, las altas temperaturas e incluso los fuertes vientos fueron factores que favorecieron la intensificación de las llamas.
Incendios de charrales
Cantidad. Año
15.515. 2020
10.425. 2021
13.062. 2022
12.777. 2023
14.128. 2024
3.050 2025
Además, en lo que va del año ya se reportan 10 incendios forestales, principalmente, en Puntarenas y Guanacaste.

author: EP
title: Boeing va a la huelga por primera vez en 16 años
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos EP Viernes, 13 de septiembre 2024, 11:46 Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Opciones para compartir El sindicato de los trabajadores de Boeing en en la región de Seattle (EE.UU.) ha convocado una huelga por primera vez en 16 años y ha rechazado la oferta del fabricante para subir un 25% los salarios. Según recoge DPA, el 94,65% de los trabajadores votaron que no a la oferta que lanzó Boeing para evitar los paros, que contemplaba una subida salarial del 25% en cuatro años, mejorar en las coberturas sanitarias y las jubilaciones, dado que el sindicato IAM había pedido inicialmente un incremento del 40% en los salarios. Además, el 96% apoyó la convocatoria de huelga. La huelga ha comenzado a las 00.00 hora local de este viernes para unos 30.000 trabajadores. Los representantes sindicales han señalado en una rueda de prensa recogida por 'Bloomberg' que los puntos del acuerdo no eran lo suficientemente buenos y que la oferta no compensaba los 16 años de estancamiento salarial, el aumento de los gastos sanitarios y la deslocalización de miles de empleos sindicales. Por su parte, Boeing ha emitido un comunicado en el que muestra su compromiso para restablecer la relación con los trabajadores y el sindicato, además de volver a la mesa para alcanzar un nuevo acuerdo. Boeing atraviesa una crisis de reputación, de seguridad y económica desde 2019, cuando dos aviones 737 MAX sufrieron accidentes fatales. Tras esto, se han producido otros incidentes, como la caída de una parte del fuselaje de un avión de Alaska Airlines a principios de este año. author: RedeTV!
title: RedeTV! Em rede com você
text: Redação RedeTV! [Fortes temporais chegam à região Sudeste nesta sexta e deixam região em alerta para risco de deslizamentos e inundações] Volume de chuva pode atingir os 200 milímetros por dia no Rio de Janeiro (Foto: Pixabay) A chegada de uma frente fria vinda da região Sul deve causar fortes temporais no Sudeste, a partir desta sexta-feira (22). Segundo o Climatempo, o tempo deve permanecer instável durante todo o final de semana. O Centro Nacional de Monitoramento e Alerta de Desastres (Cemaden) alertou que o risco de alagamentos e deslizamento de terras é muito alto nesses locais, especialmente no Rio de Janeiro, que pode registar volume de chuvas acima dos 200 milímetros por dia. O Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet) avisou que a frente fria, que já levou fortes chuvas às capitais do Sul, vai levar chuvas também para o litoral norte e Região Metropolitana de São Paulo, região sul e na Zona da Mata de Minas Gerais e ao sul do Espírito Santo. Essas regiões e todo o estado do Rio de Janeiro estão sob aviso de “grande perigo” até domingo (24), com chuvas que podem passar dos 100 milímetros por dia e ventos de até 100 km/h. A situação no Rio de Janeiro é mais preocupante, segundo o Cemaden. A frente fria vai passar lentamente pelo estado entre sexta e sábado (23), levando chuva a todo o estado. O volume de chuvas pode chegar aos 200 milímetros por dia e a possibilidade de inundações na Região Metropolitana, Região Serrana e norte fluminense é muito alta. A Zona da Mata em Minas Gerais possivelmente também terá transtornos. Meteorologistas afirmam que o grande volume de chuvas está diretamente ligado ao calor que foi registrado nos últimos dias. Segundo o Climatempo, o choque da frente fria com a atmosfera aquecida é o que contribui para os fortes temporais. Veja também! [- Ex-jogador Robinho é preso no litoral de São Paulo](http://www.redetv.uol.com.br/esportes/mais-esportes/ex-jogador-robinho-e-preso-no-litoral-de-sao-paulo) [- Comerciantes do centro histórico paulistano reclamam de falta de luz](http://www.redetv.uol.com.br/jornalismo/geral/comerciantes-do-centro-historico-paulistano-reclamam-de-falta-de-luz) [- Galerista morto no RJ: ex-marido de vítima é preso nos EUA](http://www.redetv.uol.com.br/jornalismo/geral/galerista-morto-no-rj-ex-marido-de-vitima-e-preso-nos-eua) Confira o nosso canal ' [Notícias RedeTV](https://www.youtube.com/@NoticiasRedeTV)' no Youtube: /p>

author: Raw Story
title: Ground News - Climate change hits Washington's beloved cherry blossom festival
text: It is one of the prettier fixtures of spring in Washington: thousands of cherry trees bloom amid the city's stately monuments in a spectacle that draws more than a million visitors every year.But because of Summary by Raw Story climate change , those eager to enjoy the clouds of pale pink petals and their almond-like scent have to get here earlier than they used to.Warmer weather means the peak of this gigantic bloom starts around mid-March, on average six days earli… 0 Articles 0 Articles All Left Center Right [] Raw Story Climate change hits Washington's beloved cherry blossom festival It is one of the prettier fixtures of spring in Washington: thousands of cherry trees bloom amid the city's stately monuments in a spectacle that draws more than a million visitors every year.But because of climate change, those eager to enjoy the clouds of pale pink petals and their almond-like scent have to get here earlier than they used to.Warmer weather means the peak of this gigantic bloom starts around mid-March, on average six days earli… 2 hours ago·United StatesRead Full Article Think freely.Subscribe and get full access to Ground NewsSubscriptions start at $9.99/year [Subscribe](/subscribe) Not enough coverage to generate an Article Assistant. author: Helene St. James
title: Detroit Red Wings' Trey Augustine backstops U.S. to World Juniors gold
text:
Detroit Red Wings prospect Trey Augustine backstops U.S. to World Juniors gold medal Helene St. James Detroit Free Press View Comments Two prospects who project to play key roles for the Detroit Red Wings left the World Junior Championship with remarkable performances.
Trey Augustine backstopped the U.S. team to a 6-2 victory that clinched gold in Gothenburg, Sweden, leaving the Swedes to console themselves with silver. Swedish defenseman Axel Sandin Pellikka had an assist to give him six points in seven games.
Augustine, who turns 19 in February, made 24 saves Friday.
"It's a great feeling," Augustine told local reporters. "We just stuck to our game plan, and things worked out for us. I think the turning point was early in the third when we got that goal from Buium. That settled us down. It was a great game for us. We wanted to make them make a perfect shot."
Since being drafted by the Wings last summer, he has had a standout start to his freshman year at Michigan State, posting a 2.97 goals-against average and .916 save percentage in 17 games as the Spartans have established themselves in the top 10 in the polls.
Friday's finale had the U.S. holding a 3-2 lead headed into the third period. Sandin Pellikka set up Jonathan Lekkerimaki's goal with five seconds to play in the second period. That was Sandin Pellikka's fourth assist in the prestigious tournament.
Sandin Pellikka is, essentially, who the Wings got in the trade that sent Filip Hronek to the Vancouver Canucks at last year's trade deadline. (Hronek is having a phenomenal season: He has 29 points in 38 games, and a plus-21 rating.) The Wings received a first-round pick from the Canucks, which, at No. 17, they used on Sandin Pellikka.
Sandin Pellikka, who turns 19 in March, has 13 points in 25 games with Skelleftea in the Swedish Hockey League, already topping the five points he had in 22 games in his draft year.
JUST DRIVE: Red Wings' Axel Sandin Pellikka's incredible road trip to the 2023 NHL draft
Augustine also dates from the 2023 draft, selected in the second round at No. 41 overall. The South Lyon product is an alumnus of USA Hockey's National Team Development Program. He posted a 2.14 goals-against average and .925 save percentage in 32 games in his draft year.
Defenseman Anton Johansson, a fourth-round pick from 2022, was also in Sweden's lineup. Forward Nate Danielson, the Wings' top pick, at No. 9, last summer, was part of the Canadian team that got knocked out by Czechia in the quarterfinals. Danielson's five-game tournament (one goal, two assists) was highlighted by a net-front goal he scored against Finland.
View Comments

title: Ground News - Cotswolds quad bike crash victim named as Grace Vater
text:
Summary by Ground News Two men, aged 29 and 30, have been arrested in connection with the incident. Police have appealed for anyone who saw the incident to get in touch. The victim has been named locally as a 22-year-old woman from Gloucestershire. Her family have paid tribute to her as a "beautiful, kind and loving woman" Share menu More

author: Deepak Upadhyay
title: PM Modi's outreach to Putin helped avert ‘potential nuclear attack’ on Ukraine in 2022: Report | Mint
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and some other countries outreach to Russian President Vladimir Putin helped prevent a 'potential nuclear attack' on Ukraine in 2022, news agency ANI reported on Sunday citing a CNN report.The report said two senior officials told CNN that in late 2022, the US started "preparing rigorously" for a potential nuclear strike by Moscow against Kyiv as the Biden administration was concerned that Russia might use a tactical or battlefield nuclear weapon. The report further said the fear about Russia's move began in late 2022 when Ukrainian forces were advancing on Russian-occupied Kherson in the south, the city which had been Russia's biggest prize since the invasion. As the Ukrainian forces advanced, entire Russian units were in danger of being surrounded. Also Read | Ramadan 2024: Palestinians prepare for Ramzan in shadow of Gaza warAt the same time, Moscow allegedly claimed that Ukraine might use the dirty bomb. The CNN report said the view inside the US administration was that such a catastrophic loss at Kherson could be a "potential trigger" for the use of nuclear weapons and the alleged dirty bomb claim could be intended as a cover for a Russian nuclear attack.Also Read | Princess of Wales Kate Middleton's first official photo since surgery releasedAmid the fears, the US sought to enlist the help of non-allies including India, to discourage Russia from such an attack. "One of the things we did was not only message them directly but strongly urge, press, encourage other countries, to whom they might be more attentive, to do the same thing," ANI quoted a senior administration official as saying in the CNN report.Also Read | Bengaluru water crisis: Residents ask for work from home, online classesUS officials say that outreach and public statements from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and others helped avert a crisis."I think we believe showing the international community the concern about this, particularly the concern from key countries for Russia and the Global South, was also a helpful, persuasive factor and showed them what the cost of all this could be," CNN quoted a senior administration official as saying."I think the fact that we know, India weighed in, China weighed in, others weighed in, may have had some effect on their thinking," the senior administration official added. "I can't demonstrate this positively, but I think that's our assessment."Also Read | When Ramadan 2024 moon is expected to be sighted in India, Saudi ArabiaIt is important to note that New Delhi always condemned civilian killings and called for a peaceful resolution to the Russia-Ukraine conflict.Interestingly, it was in September 2022 when in a major statement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told President Putin that "this is not the era of war" on the sidelines of the SCO summit in Uzbekistan last year. "We will definitely get a chance to discuss how we can move onto the path of peace in the coming days, I will also get an opportunity to understand your point of view," he had said.
